RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Possui graduação, mestrado e doutorado em Engenharia Metalúrgica e de Materiais (UFRJ). Diretor interino do Museu de Astronomia e Ciências Afins entre fevereiro de 2021 e janeiro de 2022, tendo atuado no cargo de Coordenador de Museologia de 2004 até março de 2018, retomando em fevereiro de 2022. É professor colaborador do curso de mestrado profissional em Preservação de Acervos da C&T (MAST) e do corpo permanente do Programa de Pós-Graduação (mestrado e doutorado) em Museologia e Patrimônio (UNIRIO/MAST). Coordenador do MINTER (PPG PMUS/UFPE). É editor científico do periódico eletrônico Museologia e Patrimônio; consultor ad-hoc do CNPq, da FAPESP, da CAPES, da CYTED, da FAPERJ e da Swiss National Science Foundation. Foi secretário do Comitê Internacional para Museus e Coleções Universitários (UMAC) do ICOM entre 2016 e 2019. Atua como Coordenador do GT-9 da ANCIB. Tem experiência na área de Museologia, com ênfase em conservação de objetos culturais metálicos e patrimônio cultural da ciência e da tecnologia, atuando principalmente nos seguintes temas: museologia, conservação, patrimônio científico - acervos e instrumentos científicos - e divulgação científica.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: has undergraduate, master's and D.Sc. in Metallurgical and Materials Engineering (UFRJ). He is a senior technologist of the Museum of Astronomy and Related Sciences, working ias head of the Museology department and teacher at the master's course in Preservation of Sc & Tech Assets (MAST). He is professor of the Graduate Program (Masters and DSc) in Museology and Heritage (UNIRIO / MAST); scientific editor of the e-journal Museology and Heritage; ad-hoc consultant of CNPq, FAPESP, CAPES, the CYTED, FAPERJ and of the Swiss National Science Foundation. He has experience in the area of museology, with an emphasis on conservation of cultural objects and cultural heritage of science and technology, acting on the following topics: museology, conservation, scientific heritage.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Objetivos: estudar os processos de patrimonialização dos acervos científicos brasileiros, sua valorização enquanto bens sociais, incluindo o desenvolver e a adaptação de processos de preservação de bens culturais de valor histórico para a C&T; o estudo as condições ambientais nos locais de guarda e exibição de acervos e suas conseqüências para a preservação dos mesmos; o estudo da utilização de materiais em áreas de guarda e exibição de acervos e os impactos daí decorrentes; o estudo e desenvolvimento de metodologias de avaliação e mitigação de impactos em sítios tombados; a realização de estudos tipológicos e funcionais de edificações; o estudo da história das coleções científicas brasileiras.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: MUSEUS UNIVERSITÁRIOS E OS EFEITOS DA PANDEMIA DE COVID 19: ASPECTOS RELACIONADOS AO PATRIMÔNIO CULTURAL DE CIÊNCIA E TECNOLOGIA
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O presente projeto contempla a pesquisa sobre o patrimônio cultural da ciência e tecnologia (PCC&T), os museus universitários no Brasil e os efeitos relacionados à pandemia COVID-19. Partindo-se de conhecimento já produzido em pesquisas anteriores, pretende-se atualizar e ampliar os dados existentes em relação à situação dos museus universitários pós-pandemia (espera-se que seja pós), especialmente aqueles que preservam o PCC&T.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-OUTRAS-ORIENTACOES-CONC.TITULO-INGLES: Railway museums in Brazil heritage running off the rails.

DETALHAMENTO-DE-OUTRAS-ORIENTACOES-CONCL.NOME-DA-INSTITUICAO: Museu de Astronomia e Ciências Afins
DETALHAMENTO-DE-OUTRAS-ORIENTACOES-CONCL.NOME-DO-CURSO: Preservação de Acervos de Ciência e Tecnologia

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Rail transport has had a great impact on Brazil?s economy, culture and society, constituting a major set of cultural heritage of national importance. An extensive railway infrastructure was built to meet the country?s needs, and Brazil?s policy to develop rail transport, followed by its privatization, had serious impacts on the railway network. In response to the deactivation of different lines and degradation of the rail assets, steps started to be taken in the 1970s to preserve this heritage, mostly on the initiative of professionals from the field and aficionados. 
Railway museums were created to gather together, protect and exhibit this heritage. When the publicly-run railway administrator, Rede Ferroviária Federal, was closed down during Brazil?s privatization process, the railway heritage of historical and cultural value came under the protection of the Brazilian heritage protection institute, Instituto do Patrimônio Histórico Artístico e Nacional.
The focus of this monograph is on railway museums and how they go about preserving Brazil?s railway heritage. A total of 37 institutions were identified across the country, most of which are run by local authorities. The data gathered shows that the heritage in question is far from being duly protected, and that most of the institutions lack the infrastructure needed for them to operate as intended.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-OUTRAS-ORIENTACOES-CONC.TITULO: A conservação de instrumentos científicos: dilemas e perspectivas no Memorial Carlos Chagas Filho
DADOS-BASICOS-DE-OUTRAS-ORIENTACOES-CONC.TITULO-INGLES: CONSERVATION OF SCIENTIFIC INSTRUMENTS: the practice of the Memorial Carlos Chagas Filho

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Assets that are transferred from generation to generation are known as cultural heritage. Each object or set of objects acknowledged for its artistic, historical or scientific significance has the right to be safeguarded as an item of cultural value and as a legacy from the past to the present and future. Innovation-oriented scientific research offers boundless potential for addressing the quest for greater precision. Meanwhile, technical and scientific instruments are becoming obsolete increasingly fast, leading to the loss of documental information, which could mean losing intrinsic aspects of knowledge. The notion of conservation is a first step for ensuring that historical instruments are safeguarded. This monograph sketches a brief history of the concept of conservation, seeking to show its origins, historical context and a few of its ramifications, such as the creation of associations, while observing more general related issues. It also highlights some ideas concerning the science of conservation and the training of professionals in the area. This is followed by a discussion of four classic theoreticians of conservation, observing what perspectives are derived from each author and where they converge and diverge, with the aim of seeing them as the basis for contemporary notions about the topic. Finally, there is a case study into the conservation of scientific instruments belonging to Espaço Memorial Carlos Chagas Filho, run by Instituto de Biofísica Carlos Chagas Filho, at the Federal University of Rio de Janeiro, with the aim of relating these practices to the theories of conservation currently being proposed for these kinds of artifacts

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This monograph discusses the preservation of a set of teaching instruments from the physics laboratory at one of the Colégio Pedro II schools in the center of Rio de Janeiro. Colégio Pedro II was the first official secondary education institution to be established in Brazil. It occupied the premises of the former Seminário São Joaquim, a seminary for orphans from the first half of the eighteenth century, formerly São Pedro orphanage. In the study, a set of objects was chosen, described and characterized. Their state of conservation was diagnosed in the light of some precepts of preservation with the aim of identifying approaches for preserving the set as a whole. Some general parameters for preservation are proposed, which could serve as guidelines for other teaching laboratories in Brazil. All the instruments were in a state of neglect resulting from the fact that the laboratory is no longer used. They were dirty and showed signs of different degrees of deterioration, which was further exacerbated by the diversity of materials they were made of. Given the objects? value as testaments to an important period in Brazilian education, it is imperative that action be taken to safeguard and research them.
